security: Revealing that the Embassy needs the COS to "approach JYVAPOROUS" and admitting that "COS MUST ADMIT CARRY-ING-WATER-FOR THIS EMBASSY IS A SOMEWHAT-DISTASTEFUL CHORE" shows a degree of friction or reluctance within the agency.
summary: The US Embassy requests assistance from the COS in Minsk to gain access to JFK assassination records in Belorussian archives, following unsuccessful attempts and ahead of the Assassination Records Review Board's visit.
summary_one_paragraph: In October 1996, a secret cable details the US Embassy's request for assistance from the Chief of Station (COS) in Minsk to facilitate access to JFK assassination records held in Belorussian archives. The embassy's previous attempts to access these records, including those consulted by Norman Mailer for his book, have been unsuccessful. With a team from the Assassination Records Review Board scheduled to arrive on October 29 to meet with government officials, the embassy seeks the COS's intervention to secure access to the records before the team's arrival, despite the COS expressing some reluctance.
title: RE: <JFK ASSASSINATION>RECORDS TEAM
